author: HQuiff
title: Creativity In Design
review:
I received this small, cute, and beautiful mini-model 2 Days ago for Christmas, to be honest, I received two of these, along with others like the 4899 Tractor, the 5625 Police 4x4 (Two of 'em), 7799 Cargo Copter, and the 7800 Off Road Racer (Another two).

To start with, the build is fun and really gets you thinking something like; "Oh yeah!" and "Those designs are brilliant, I wonder where I could use those.", not to mention, "Great pieces!" etc. 

For such a small model this contains a good amount of rare and handy pieces, such as earth green shoe pieces on the tail, and the tan shoes as the feet. And of course odd colouring on cheese slopes never goes amiss. 

The overall mechanisms are always needed on any model (A lot don't have it), and the overall look adds characteristics. Just look at that face!
HQuiff, A.K.A Bricksoar

author: Phrea
title: Underrated set
review:
This little set is underrated.  

It's small, but since it mostly uses plates, there is a lot of detail in it. I mean, look at it's head/face, it's very recognizable with the few pieces used.

Pros

  • Fun little build
  • It's a stegosaurus !
  • Cool use of parts
  • Plate galore !

Cons

  • For such a small set, I can't see any cons, to be honest. It's recognizable as a Stegosaurus.

Since I'm an AFOL, playability of sets is not what I'm after, so, from my point of view, I gave it a relatively low 3/5

My conclusion is that this is a fun build, small as it may be, due to the usage of plates it's very recognizable as a Stegosaurus.  

I'll be displaying it, because it's a fun little set.
